meta.name: description
meta.content: Follow our democracy in action! See what's happening today in the House and in committee meetings, as well as news and events

head.title: Welcome to the House of Commons of Canada

div.div: There are no meetings scheduled for today.

a.div: An idea to make a new law or change an existing law starts out as a bill.
Compilation of recorded votes, where the names of those voting for and against a motion are registered.
Petitions are an easy way to participate in Canada's democracy.
Committees are small groups of parliamentarians created to perform key tasks.

div.h3: Most Discussed Topics in the House

div.p: Select a date to view past or scheduled Parliamentary Business. This calendar goes as far back as December 3, 2015. Previous business can be consulted by selecting relevant links on this page.

In honour of Remembrance Day, the Poppy Drop—a virtual display of falling poppies—will be projected onto the Peace Tower every evening from October 25 to November 10, from 6:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m., and on November 11 from 6:30 p.m. to midnight. Each of the 117,000 falling poppies represents one of those who gave up their life in service to our country.
